page.title: 11Strenham Service Station
page.content: Strensham Service Station lies on the M5, ten miles south of Worcester and five miles north of Tewkesbury, on a site of approximately twenty acres. It was completed in 1962 and it is estimated that one million people pass through the catering side in one year. The buildings have two self service cafeterias, one waitress service restaurant, a takeaway,a bakery, two shops and the usual offices and toilet facilities. There are petrol pumps on each side and a garage on the southbound side. The estimated turnover is Â£5 million, and approximately Â£300 000 is paid to the 200 staff. Apart from car parking facilities there is an overnight lorry park on each side together with a control station for the motorway police on the northbound side.
